page.title: 20LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {John Elder}was born on 8 March 1824. He died on the 17th of September 1869 aged only 45 years old. He was an engineer and shipbuilder. In 1854 he invented the compound engine which halved the amount of coal a ship needed to carry in it's bunkers. In 1864 Elder founded the {Fairfield Shipbuilding Company}in Govan. Elder Park facing the upper Clyde was gifted to the people of Govan by{Mrs Elder}in memory of her late husband. The park cost Â£50,000 and extends to 35 acres. It was opened on 27 June 1885. As a token of their appreciation of this action and because of her husbands many outstanding qualities, the Govanites erected a statue to his fine achievement. At a later date a statue was erected in memory of his wife.
